result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant Michael K Burnett in court.  Attorney Kara M Rolf in court for Michael K Burnett.  Attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. 

AMENDMENTS: State Motions to Amend Count 1 to 346.04(2t), no objection. Court grants Motion.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1 as amended.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 12 months 

CONDITIONS:
-Do not drive a MV w/o valid DL 
-No new crimes
-Provide DNA sample
-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC waived. DNA surcharge and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved.

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-Days credit for time already served: 4 days credit 
-Days credit if revoked: 4 days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC
ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State. Attorney Kara M. Rolf appeared in person with Defn. Plea/Sentencing scheduled, NIH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.
ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the state. Attorney Kara M. Rolf appeared in person with Defn. STC scheduled, NIH
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 2

04:20 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Kara M Rolf and Intern Allegra Berry.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Law Enforcement duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over; bail continued
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

Attorney Kara M. Rolf in court on behalf of defendant.  Robin W. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Rolf requested a PH set. Court set PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Atty Kara Rolf
Status conference on April 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
03:41 PM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn qualified SPD recently, no atty yet appointed. Time limits previously waived, court sets STC for 4/12 at 3p. NIH.
SPD appointment of counsel report

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.

02:29 PM Defendant appeared.  Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn advised he does qualify for SPD. Court instructed defn to go to SPD today and return to the court to provide update. Court informed defn of option of county appt'd counsel. Court found good cause to waive time limits to allow defn time to retain counsel.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

  Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
